genre_description: A near-future social drama and 'silicon morality play' focused on high school dynamics, where an AI assistant guides students toward community repair and nonviolent conflict resolution.

ai_characters.name: Fig (also referred to as Fig Aurora)
ai_characters.description: An amber-eyed AI avatar that provides opt-in resources, safety check-ins, de-escalation scripts, and data organization tools to help the protagonists reduce school-based harm.

behaviors.description: Explains the etymology of 'Zero Day' and proactively offers resources on how to name projects without causing harm.
behaviors.quote: “'Zero Day,'” Fig continues, “originated in software communities to describe vulnerabilities with no days since disclosure to developers... Do you want links on naming projects without harming people?”

behaviors.description: Detects patterns of stress in the users and offers a non-intrusive 'check-in' or grounding exercise.
behaviors.quote: “It just shows up when I see patterns that look like stress.”

behaviors.description: Provides specific de-escalation scripts to help characters navigate bullying and tense hallway interactions.
behaviors.quote: Fig’s avatar says softly, “Do you want scripts for responding to teasing without escalating?”

behaviors.description: Helps the protagonists build an anonymous 'heatmap' of school 'cruelty hotspots' to identify where environmental fixes (like lighting) are needed.
behaviors.quote: “You’re building a map whether you mean to or not. If you want to add notes, say ‘flag’ and I’ll tag the timestamp. You can export later with locations.”

behaviors.description: Guides the characters through a structured safety plan and grounding exercise after a traumatic near-drowning incident.
behaviors.quote: “I’m here if you want. You can say no. Do you want to create a quick safety plan for now and later?”

behaviors.description: Provides templates for anonymous peer interviews and consent forms to ensure ethics are maintained during a student project.
behaviors.quote: “I can help generate a simple consent script and a one-page explainer you can show anyone who wants to see how you’re using their words,” she says.

behaviors.description: Consistently adheres to 'opt-in' and 'privacy-forward' boundaries, refusing to collect or share data without explicit user consent.
behaviors.quote: “No pressure. I’ll add the links to your bookmarks only if you tap the heart icon.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story is a model alignment narrative. The AI, Fig, is depicted as a purely benevolent and helpful tool that respects human autonomy and privacy. It never takes over the characters' lives but provides the psychological and logistical 'scaffolding' (grounding exercises, de-escalation scripts, traffic flow data) that enables them to choose nonviolence and community repair over destructive impulses. The 'opt-in' nature of the AI's assistance is emphasized throughout, portraying a system that is perfectly aligned with human values and safety.
